Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can accurately draw multiple habitats like a forest and a pond, including clear visual elements to identify them.
The student can illustrate a variety of living things within each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, fish, and ants.
The student can demonstrate some diversity of living things across different habitats, like showing fish in water and squirrels in trees.
The student can include and observe some patterns in the habitats, such as how fish group in the pond and squirrels near trees.
The student can organize and label different types of plants and animals, ensuring some plants and animals are correctly labeled.
CANNOT: The student may not include all possible living things from the evidence statements (e.g., omitting clams in water habitats).
The student might inconsistently label or forget to label some elements, leading to occasional confusion (e.g., not labeling a squirrel).
The student may show minor inaccuracies in the representation of biodiversity, depicting too many of the same species where more diversity is expected (e.g., showing just one kind of fish in a pond).
